chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Larry D Van Dusen was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
in Wisconsin State Prison System consecutive.  Defendant is entitled to 77 days presentence credit.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs, blood draw fee and DNA surcharge through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office within 60 days (8/23/16) unless a payment plan has been established.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

Defendant must engage in weekly treatment with focus on alcoholism.

supervisions.notes: shall be installed on any motor vehicle owned and/or operated by defendant.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Larry D Van Dusen in court, in custody with attorney John Chappell Orth.  Gilbert G. Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PSI rec'd and reviewed by all parties; Agent is present; State heard on recomm. (prison); Atty. Orth heard (probation); Def. makes statement; Court imposes sentence; Def. remanded

**58 month in WI State Prison System - 22 mo. IC and 36 mo. ES - 77 days credit
Conditions of ES:
- $1800 F+C = $3,039 w/in 60 days or payment plan
- $250 DNA surcharge and sample
- $40 blood draw fee
- AODA & VIP
- absolute sobriety, no bars
- no drugs, etc.
- engage in weekly treatment with focus on alcoholism
- not operate without valid WI operator's license
* 3 year Rev. & IID

Def. is eligible for SAP/CIP and ERP

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on June 24, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Larry D Van Dusen in court with attorney John Chappell Orth.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion Hearing on Collateral Attack. Discussion held. Atty Orth chooses not to proceed with motion. Discussion held. Parties agree to plea and then request PSI. Court reviews rights, charges and penalties. BAC .200. Def enters Guilty plea to Ct 1 OWI 5th. Court accepts plea and finds guilty of Ct 1; Ct 2 is dismissed; Ct 3 is DRI. Discussion held. Court orders PSI & sets Sentencing Hearing. No longer eligible for bail, shall be held at DCJ until sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing on April 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.

LIMITED SOLEY TO PURPOSE OF TRAVEL TO AND FROM ONLY - NO STOPS BETWEEN WORK/COUNSELING AND HOME. ANY STOPS WILL BE CONSIDERED BAIL JUMPING.

Defendant Larry D Van Dusen in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties heard on stip to amend bond; Court will order bond amended to $5000 cash and all other conditons of bond remain the same  Arraignment scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes. Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.

12:54 - Defendant Larry D Van Dusen in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan (may be eligible).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $10,000 Cash bond with conditions:   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court. Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Review hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:15 am.
